A complete collection of practice code and mini-projects from a MERN stack certification.

This repository documents a learning journey, from the fundamentals to building full-stack applications.

ðŸš€ What's Inside?

This repository isn't a single app, but a collection of projects and exercises. Here's what you'll find:

âš›ï¸ Frontend Projects: Client-side applications built with React, HTML, and CSS.

âš™ï¸ Backend APIs: Server-side logic, RESTful APIs, and database connections built with Node.js and Express.js.

ðŸ“„ Fundamental Concepts: Smaller code files in /basics covering core JavaScript, MERN, and web development principles.

ðŸ§  Revision Notes: Code and notes used for study and revision in the /revision folder.

ðŸ§° Core Tech Stack

This repository focuses on the MERN stack and related web technologies.



## Frontend => React, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ES6+), EJS
## Backend => Node.js, Express.js
## Database => MongoDB 
## Environment => Node.js



ðŸ¤” Why This Repository?

This repository was created to document the learning process and showcase all the practice code and mini-projects built during a MERN stack certification. It serves as a personal portfolio and a "digital notebook" of progress.

ðŸ§ª How to Use This Repository

Since this is a collection of different projects, there is no single "run" command.

Clone the repo

git clone [https://github.com/coderMayank69/FULLSTACK](https://github.com/coderMayank69/FULLSTACK)
cd FULLSTACK


Explore a Project

Navigate into a specific project directory (e.g., within /Frontend or /backend).

Look for its own package.json or README.md to find instructions on how to install dependencies and run it.

# Example for a sub-project
cd Frontend/my-react-app
npm install
npm start


This repository is primarily for personal learning, but suggestions and contributions are welcome! Please feel free to submit a Pull Request or open an issue.
